item.title: My MoveMouse
item.dc:creator: @surfer247 surfer247
item.description:
@surfer247 wrote:

I was talking about this being a completely external project from the RS client. If you were going to go through and edit the client, I think you could do a better job than creating a color clicker in it… But, I think if you were able to load the RS client through this Java application, you should be able to send it the mouse events.

item.title: My MoveMouse
item.dc:creator: @surfer247 surfer247
item.description:
@surfer247 wrote:

If you wanted to get really sneaky, you could generate fake mouse events. THat way, you won’t move the mouse (and you can use the mouse to do whatever you want), and the program still registers a mouse move/click/whatever. Unfortunately, I haven’t found a way to actually send the mouse events to a different program (for example the RS window) so it would be pretty useless unless you could open the RS window inside of a diffferent Java application, in which case, it might work. It would be interesting. Here’s a sample of the code:

public MouseEvent clickMouse(int x, int y, JFrame page){ try{ if(silentMouse){ e = new MouseEvent(page , MouseEvent.MOUSE_CLICKED , 0 , 0 , x , y , 0 , false); return (e); }else{ robot.mouseMove(x,y); robot.mousePress(InputEvent.BUTTON1_MASK); robot.mouseRelease(InputEvent.BUTTON1_MASK); } }catch(Exception f){} return null; } public MouseEvent moveMouse(int x, int y, JFrame page){ try{ if(silentMouse){ e = new MouseEvent(page , MouseEvent.MOUSE_MOVED , 0 , 0 , x , y , 0 , false); return (e); }else{ robot.mouseMove(x,y); } }catch(Exception f){} return null; }

That part actually creates the fake mouse event and this part processes it:

processEvent(-[your event here]-);

Hmmmmmmm, might be useful

Read full topic

item.title: My MoveMouse
item.dc:creator: @koffe koffe
item.description:
@koffe wrote:

Well i am a noob to java (programming:P) so dont get mad at me just cos its noobie or its rely bad…
here it is:P

[code]import java.applet.*;
import java.awt.AWTException;
import java.awt.Color;
import java.awt.Graphics;
import java.awt.Robot;
import java.util.Random;

public class Main extends Applet implements Runnable {

public void wait(int time){
   try {
	Thread.sleep(time);
} catch (InterruptedException e) {
}
}

public void moveMouse(int x,int y) {
	Robot rob=null;
	try {
		rob = new Robot();
	} catch (AWTException e) {
	}
	rob.mouseMove(x,y);	
	
}


public int random(int ran) {
	Random Ran = new Random();
	return 0+Ran.nextInt(ran);
}

public boolean more(int a, int b ) {
	boolean ret = false;
	if (a > b) {
		ret = false;
	}else {
		ret = true;
	}
	return ret;
}

public void move(int x){
	int yspeed=0,ypos=50;
	int a=10,b=x;
	moveMouse(10,50);
	wait(100);
	for (int i = 10; i < b- 4; i++){
	for (int c = -1; c < random(3); c++){
		yspeed = c;
	} if (i < b  / a * 9) {
		switch (yspeed) {
		case -1 : yspeed= +1;break;
		case +1 : yspeed= -1;break;
		default : yspeed= 0; break;
		}
		if (more ( ypos, i)==true) {
			for (int w = 2; w < 2; w--){
				yspeed = w;
			} if ( ypos > i) {
				yspeed = +1;
			}
		

		}
	}
		ypos += yspeed;
		moveMouse(i,ypos);
		wait(random(20));	
}
	
	moveMouse(x,50);
}

public void init() {
move(200);
}

public void run(){

}
public void start(){
Thread th = new Thread (this);
th.start();
}

}
[/code]
